meanings.definition: Having a higher price than something else.
meanings.sent1: The new phone was pricier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Designer clothes are usually pricier than regular ones.
meanings.sent3: I never expected vegetables to be pricier than gold!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pricier as a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The idea of traveling to space seemed as pricier as owning a private island.

meanings.sent1: Eating out at fancy restaurants can be pricier than cooking at home.
meanings.sent2: The luxury car was pricier than the economy model.
meanings.sent3: I never thought a simple cup of coffee could be pricier than a gourmet meal!
meanings.sent4: His time was pricier than any material possession.
meanings.sent5: The memories we create together are pricier than any gift.
